intro: Lotononis grandis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of purple, white, and pink. The plant belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its compact growth habit makes it ideal for indoor gardening and decorative arrangements.
